page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF COMBROOK.
page.content: In the north of our area lies Combrook,to be reached by following a spur off the Fossway.The village was once part of Kineton.From the top of Pittern Hill, you descend to Combrook,possibly the most secluded village in the whole of Warwickshire.Most of the houses date from the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.The village became a separate parish in 1853 and hence it is not surprising to note that the architecture of the church is "free Gothic" and dating largely from 1866.For a long time the village was part of the Verney estate,based upon the stately home of Compton Verney,home of the Willoughby de Broke's.Unfortunately the house has been allowed to fall into disrepair and is at the time of writing up for sale.
